metadata.title: CVE-2022-4139 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An incorrect TLB flush issue was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s GPU i915kernel driver, potentially leading to random memory corruption or dataleaks. This flaw could allow a local user to crash the system or escalatetheir privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-67-generic-64k - 5.15.0-67.74
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1029-kvm - 5.15.0-1029.34
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-67.74').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1029.34').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1031.35').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1034.41').

linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1026.29').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1026.31').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-67.74').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.36').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1032.33').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1025.27').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1016.16').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1004.4').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-35.36~22.04.1').
